channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large tree, 10th June
item.description:
There are large tree at the rear of widmore logde road number 19, that overshadow the garden and property. Can these be investigated and pruned

item.description:

item.title: Weeds need to be removed along Heversham Rd Bexley, 10th June
item.description:
3 x men came down Heversham Rd, Bexleyheath today - lady said they had shovels. They kicked a few weeds around o/s 35 Heversham Rd did a bit of sweeping then went off again...without removing the weeds. Also opp no 35 the overgrown vegetation is getting quite bad aswell and needs attention The weeds are growing up along the gutters of the road, she wants to know if they will be going back to do the job properly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 35, Heversham Road, Upper Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Slide is loose and splintery, 10th June
item.description:
A nut and bolt is missing from the slide in the playback near the asda superstore (graham road, Bexleyheath) car park and back of church at The Broadway. It is also splinters on the sides where children hold onto as they come down the slide.

item.title: Grass Verge, 10th June
item.description:
Email received by CSC inbox 10/06/25 09:18 • Does your complaint contain notification of a data protection breach? no • Please give brief details of your complaint or compliment below: Every year the grass verge outside my house is neglected. It has not been cut once this year. The nettles are so high someone has dumped a television in there and it’s invisible. The trees are overhanging and it’s not looked after. This has been an ongoing issue and every year i complain.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25, Millfields Cottages, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside no 50, 10th June

item.title: Flytiiping Electrical fridge freezer abandoned in the car park of whitgift House SE11 6AG, 10th June
item.description:
Somebody has discarded and fly tipped a fridge freezer in the car park of Whitgift house SE11 6AG. It has been here for over two weeks and no action has been taken by Lambeth Council. Lambeth Council removed this discarded fridge today, urgently and without any more delay, before someone hurts themselves. Failure to remove immediately will force us to logg an official complaint and escalate matters.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whitgift Street, Lambeth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cycle barrier stops cycle tourists and trailers, 10th June
item.description:
This cycle barrier should be removed. Many cycle tourists use this route, which is part of NCN1, either to come from the Continent to tour England or going from London to the Continent. They are heavily-laden with panniers and other luggage, which they have to remove in order to get their bikes through the barrier. This barrier may have been installed to prevent motorbikes accessing the path, but they come over the adjacent fields and bypass the barrier. I am a volunteer helping to manage the vegetation along the path, so I have a trailer behind my bike carrying all our tools. I have to disconnect the trailer and it is not easy to man-handle it through the barrier.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cray Riverway + London Loop, Barnes Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge builders advertising, 10th June
item.description:
Looks very out of place,too large

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chislehurst Road, Petts Wood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large tree branch half hanging off tree, 10th June
item.description:
A large tree on the estate has a half broken branch with a lot of weight to it hanging from the tree. The branch has snapped but not fully. I am concerned for if and when the tree would snap completely that this could hit a member of the public, especially any young children in the area as they like to play out the front. Not only that, the tree is very close to where cars are parked and if it was to fall a certain way, it has the potential of causing severe damage to parked cars. Please can this be sorted ASAP.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Petersham Gardens, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Duddington Close, Elmstead, London

item.description:
Deep Sunken damaged drain and surrounding area Cars/ Lorries going over sunken drain are being jostled violently and cars swerving to avoid it are going into the next lane Drain is located on M25 roundabout Junction 25 coming from Waltham Abbey turning going southwards towards Enfield on the A10
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): M25, London
